![Chuncheon Myeongdong Street (ì¶˜ì²œ ëª…ë™ê±°ë¦¬)](/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2030528_image2_1.webp) ## Overview > The street was named after Seoulâ€™s Myeong-dong street as it became the main street of Chuncheon. Government offices, such as Gangwon-do Provincial Office and Chuncheon City Hall, and major banks are located nearby the street, and various shops specialized in clothes, cosmetics, and shoes, as well as cafes and restaurants are located in the street. The sculpture built to remember the street as the filming location for the Korean TV drama Winter Sonata is located in the middle of Myeongdong Street. In addition, the street has large shopping malls, such as M Department Store and Brown 5th Avenue, cinema, and other attractions. The large-scale underground shopping center established based on the Jungang Rotary, houses some 350 stores where customers can enjoy shopping and relaxation in any weather. The Myeongdong Street connects to other Chuncheonâ€™s tourist destinations, including Myeongdong Dakgalbi Alley of Chuncheon, Yungnim Pass, and Chuncheon Jungang Market. ## Intro | | | | - | - | |infocenter:|â€¢ 1330 Travel Hotline: +82-2-1330
(English, Korean, Japanese, Chinese)
â€¢ For more info: +82-33-250-3089| ## Detail Image ![/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2030526_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2030526_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2030527_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2030527_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2030529_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2030529_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2030530_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2030530_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2030532_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2030532_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2030533_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2030533_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2495147_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2495147_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2495151_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2495151_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-25-1658757394112/619243_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-25-1658757394112/619243_image2_1.webp) ## Contact - [â˜ï¸+82-33-250-3089](tel:+82332503089) - [ğŸ tour.chuncheon.go.kr](http://tour.chuncheon.go.kr/) ```googleMap latitude: 37.8800481627 longitude: 127.7275492614 title: 55, Jungang-ro, Chuncheon-si, Gangwon-do ``` ## Directions [Bus]
Take bus 7, 9, 64, or 64-2 across from Chuncheon Intercity Bus Terminal.
Get off at Myeong-dong Bus Stop. (10 min ride)

[Subway]
Chuncheon Station (Gyeongchun Line)
Take bus 63 and get off at Myeong-dong Bus Stop. (10 min ride)

data.title: Chuncheon Myeongdong Street (ì¶˜ì²œ ëª…ë™ê±°ë¦¬)
data.description: The street was named after Seoulâ€™s Myeong-dong street as it became the main street of Chuncheon. Government offices, such as Gangwon-do Provincial Office and Chuncheon City Hall, and major banks are located nearby the street, and various shops specialized in clothes, cosmetics, and shoes, as well as cafes and restaurants are located in the street. The sculpture built to remember the street as the filming location for the Korean TV drama Winter Sonata is located in the middle of Myeongdong Street. In addition, the street has large shopping malls, such as M Department Store and Brown 5th Avenue, cinema, and other attractions. The large-scale underground shopping center established based on the Jungang Rotary, houses some 350 stores where customers can enjoy shopping and relaxation in any weather. The Myeongdong Street connects to other Chuncheonâ€™s tourist destinations, including Myeongdong Dakgalbi Alley of Chuncheon, Yungnim Pass, and Chuncheon Jungang Market.
data.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: The Literary Village of Kim You Jeong (ê¹€ìœ ì •ë¬¸í•™ì´Œ)
dataList.description: The Literary Village of Kim You Jeong was established on the site of the birth home of Kim, in order to commemorate Kim You-jeong who left various great short story novels of Koreaâ€™s modern times, such as Spring, Spring (1935), and Camellia Flower (1936). It was opened in 2002, consisting of the Birth Home of Kim You-jeong, Memorial Hall, foot-operated mortar, etc. Then, in 2016, various facilities, such as Kim You-jeongâ€™s Story House, outdoor stage, experience room, and Nangman Nuri were additionally built across the Literary Village of Kim You-jeong. The current birth home with the square-shaped structure, which is the typical hanok (traditional Korean house) style, was restored according to historical research by Kimâ€™s relatives and students. The Memorial Hall provides information and displays artifacts related to Kim You-jeongâ€™s life and works. Kim You-jeongâ€™s Story House shows three-dimensional exhibits and videos related to his works and life. Various sculptures made with the themes of Kimâ€™s short story novels are placed throughout its outside area. It is recommended to walk along the Sille Story Road after visiting the Literary Village. The Sille Story Road is a trail, which is a literature tour, consisting of the places that appeared in Kimâ€™s novels with the background of his hometown.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: The Korean Kimchi Grand Master Kim Soon Ja, Kimchi Theme Park (ê¹€ìˆœìëª…ì¸ ê¹€ì¹˜í…Œë§ˆíŒŒí¬)
dataList.description: The Korean Kimchi Grand Master Kim Soon Ja, Kimchi Theme Park is located in Jeongseon, Gangwon-do. The theme park is dedicated to promoting kimchi to the world. Visitors can learn about the history and development of kimchi as well as other interesting facts. Various programs are also offered for visitors of all ages.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: The 4th Tunnel (ì œ4ë•…êµ´)
dataList.description: The 4th Tunnel was discovered on March 3, 1990. It is located 1,200 meters from the Military Demarcation Line in the demilitarized zone of South Korea. This is the only tunnel to be discovered that provides full access to tour groups. Educational instruction is given in the square outside the tunnel.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: The 2nd Tunnel - Cheorwon (ì œ2ë•…êµ´ (ì² ì›))
dataList.description: The 2nd Tunnel, which was made by North Koreans to invade South Korea, was discovered on March 24, 1975. This tunnel is 3.5 kilometers long and sits 50~160 meters below the surface. It stretches out 1.1 kilometers and 2.4 kilometers in the south and north directions respectively. Only 500 meters is open for tourism among the whole length. Inside of the tunnel, there is a plaza to gather a large military force. The tunnel is divided into 3 exits. The use of this tunnel would allow for thirty thousand armed forces as well as tanks to pass through per hour. For now, the tunnel is operated as part of Cheorwon Security Tourism Course and many tourists visit this area every year.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Taebaeksan National Park (íƒœë°±ì‚° êµ­ë¦½ê³µì›)
dataList.description: Taebaeksan Mountain range encompasses several peaks such as Yeongbong Peak (alt. 1,560 m), where in the past, people would conduct rites to venerate Heaven at Cheonjedan Altar; Janggunbong Peak (alt. 1,567 m), Munsubong Peak (alt. 1,517 m), and its summit of Hambaeksan Mountain (alt. 1,572 m). Taebaeksan Mountain serves as a home to diverse wild animals and plants, including several endangered species. The higher plains are covered with alpine vegetation. The mountain becomes hot pink with mountain rhododendron and azalea in the spring; green with thick forest and pristine waters in the summer; rainbow colored with changing leaves in the fall; and white with snow in the winter.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Taebaek Sangjang-dong Mural Village (íƒœë°± ìƒì¥ë™ ë²½í™”ë§ˆì„)
dataList.description: Taebaek Sangjang-dong Mural Village, also called â€œNambu Villageâ€, is located in Sangjang-dong, Taebaek-si as the name refers. The village has been improved upon by residents who volunteered and shared their artistic talents to participate in Taebaek-siâ€™s new village movement in 2011. Each alley throughout the village gives a unique and refreshing ambience that created a turning point in the village. Also, valuable events such as â€˜Yeontan (briquette) painting contestâ€™ are held for students and families to participate in and share their warm hearts. The Central Inland Region Train (O-Train), which began operating as of April 12, 2013 by Korail, stops in Taebaek-si, so tourists can easily reach the mural village via train.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Taebaek Guwau Village (Alpine Botanical Garden) (íƒœë°± êµ¬ì™€ìš°ë§ˆì„(ê³ ì›ììƒì‹ë¬¼ì›))
dataList.description:
Guwau Village is located below Pijae Hill (also called Samsuryeong) at the entrance to Maebongsan Mountain. The village got its name because its topography resembles the scenery of nine cows peacefully lying around. The Alpine Botanical Garden is located 800-900 meters above sea level and protects the endangered alpine plant species from disappearing.

The botanical garden also offers visitors an opportunity to conveniently observe some rare flowers and plants. In August, when the sunflowers are in full bloom, the Taebaek Sunflower Festival is held at Guwau Village. In addition to celebrating the areaâ€™s wide array of colorful flowers, the festival also has a variety of attractions such as a drawing exhibition, a photo exhibition, and an environmental sculpture exhibition using repurposed materials.
dataList.author: korea-tour
